unnormalised: So, P(A) = 0.6, P(B) = 0.4 and P(A âˆ© B) = 0.2, then P(A | B) = 0.2/0.4 = 0.5; understanding conditional probability is key in stats!
normalised: So, P of A equals zero point six, P of B equals zero point four and P of A intersection B equals zero point two, then P of A given B equals zero point two divided by zero point four equals zero point five; understanding conditional probability is key in statistics!
